Questions.question: The following are true except
options: Embryology is the study of the development of an embryo from the stage of ovum fertilization to the fetal stage
Embryogenesis is the process of initiation and development of an embryo from a zygote
Embryogenesis is the developmeantal period within the first eight weeks of gestation
Fetogenesis is the fetal development occurs through an exceptionally organized sequence of cell division enlargement and differentiation
Questions.explanation: Embryology is the study of the development of an embryo from the stage of ovum fertization

Questions.question: With regards to gametogenesis
options: Gametogenesis is a biological process by which haploid cells undergo division and differntiation to form mature diploid gametes
Spermatogenesis begins with mitotic division of the stem cells close to the basement membrane of the tubules
Type A cells replenish the stem cells, and type B cells differentiate into primary spematocytes
The primary spermatocytes divides meiotically (meiosis I) into four secondary spermatocytes
The process of Spermatogenesis occurs to creates immature male gametes

Questions.question: The following can affect spermatogenesis
options: Pituitary gland
Hypothalamus
Sertoli cell
Inhibin
Drugs

Questions.question: With regards oogenesis
options: A femal neonate is deliverd with all her primary oocytes
The first meiotic division get arrested at metaphase
The second meiotic division starts at fertilization
Produces non motile gamete
Folliculogenesis is the maturation of an ovarian follicle

Questions.question: With regards to fertilization
options: It is the fusion of hapliod gametes to form a diploid zygote
Initates the beginning of the second meiosis
The motility of the sperm cell is not important in fertilization
It involves the exchange of genetic materials
Zonal reaction takes place on day 4 of fetal life

Questions.question: The following are true about fertilazation except
options: It is the fusion of the male and female pronuclei
It is the completion of the second meiotic division
The second polar body plays an important role
The zonal reaxtion prevents polyspermia
It is a complex multi-step process that is completed in one week

Questions.question: Which of the following is/are true
options: The chromosomes of the mature oocyte decondenses to form a pronucleus
12 to 32 blastomers cluster together toform a morula
Peristaic activity continues to move the dividing blastomere from the fallopian tube into the uterine cavity
The morula arrives the uterine cavity on day 4 post fertilization
On gestation day6, the trophoblasts differentiate into the cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast

Questions.question: The following are true except
options: Implantation is a complex biochemical and mechanical process that begins in the first week of gestation and extends into the second week
The deepest layer of the endometrium is the stratum basalis
The syncytiotrophoblast is unicellular with cell wall
The cytotrophoblast is mitotically active
The bilaminar disc is made up of ectoderm and endoderm

Questions.question: Which of the following is/are true
options: The cytiotrophoblast is a highly invasive structure that penetrates the endometrium in order for the blastocyst to become embedded
The syncytiotrophoblast begins to produce human chorionic gonadotropin hormone
Epiblastic cell form the floor of the amiontic cavity
The hypoblast is continuous with the exoclomic(Heuser's) membrane
The lacunae become confluent forming lacunar networks which serve as the primordial uteroplacental circulation

Questions.question: The following are true concerning the cardiac muscle except
options: Contractions are continous and controlled by external autonomic and hormonal stimuli
Fibers are long, cylindrical cells with one centrally located nucleus
Their fibres funtion like a syncytium
They have a striated arrangement at the end of adjacents cells which are intercalated disc
Their fibers are highly modified cells which constitute the pacemaker regions of the heart thereby forming a purkinje system

Questions.question: Concerning the Harversian, which of these is/are false?
options: Is a system of concentric lamellae of bones surrounding a canal
It is s system of concentric lamellae of bones surrounding a cananl containing blood vessels, nerve, and loose connective tissue
The Harversian canal is found in compact bones
Its canal is lined by endosteum and contain blood vessels, nerves and loose connective tissue
The system communicates with the marrow, periosteum and with each other through tranvers or oblique Volkmann's canal

Questions.question: The following is true except
options: Dark bands are called A-bands while light bands are called I-Bands
Running through the centre of the H-Band is a thin dark line which is the M-Band
The middle of A-band is tranversed by a lighter band called the H-Band
The distance between two Z-Bands is a sarcomere
H-Band is named after Hanson while M-Band is namec after Mittleschiebe

Questions.question: The following statements are true
options: Individual muscle fibers are surrounded by delicate connective tissue known as endomysium
Individual fasciculi are surrounded by a stronger sheath of connective tissue called the perimysium
The connective tissue that surround the entire muscle is called the epimysium
A-Band is confined to one sarcomere but the I-Band is made up of parts of two sarcomeres that meet at the Z-Bands
Within the muscles, the muscular fibers are arranged in the form of bundles or fasciculi

Questions.question: The following statements is correct
options: The total displacement that a muscle can produce is propotional to the length of is fiber
The strength of contraction of a muscle depends on the number of fibers in the muscle
Muscle differs only in the way the fasciculi are arranged
All of the above
None of the above

Questions.question: The events at the neuromuscular junction
options: Is initiated by termination of nerve impulse
Includes the termination of nerve impulse usually leading to release of acetylcholine
Include attachment of acetylcholine to muscle end plate to initiate entry of Na+ into muscle membrane
Include generation of local end plate potential on reaching critical magnitude which leads to depolarization of muscle fiber
Includes depolarization of muscle fibers leading to propagation of muscle action potential with entry of calcium that results in mechanical contraction of muscles

Questions.question: Which of the following is correct about the satellite cell
options: It is present in smooth muscles
It is present in skeletal muscle
It is present in cardiac muscle
All of the above

options: Alopecia

Bromhidrosis

Cortex
Curticle
Huxley's layer

Questions.explanation: Component of the hair shaft include cortex, medulla and cuticle. Huxley's layer is the component of the inner root sheath

options: It is laterally oriented in the leg(sura)
Its head reaches Proximally to the inferolateral surface of the lateral tibial condyle
It does not take part in the knee joint formation

options: It is the large terminal branch of the sciatic nerve
Has the same nerve origin as the sciatic nerve
Continues into the leg as the common peroneal nerve

options: It may be due to congenital sac
It is never found in the neonate
Rarely occur in children

options: The sibson's fascia is triangular in shape

The base of the suprapleural membrane is attached to the outer border of the 1st rib

options: Right atrium
SVC
IVC
Arch of aorta
Pulmonary trunk

Questions.question: Relations of the anterior part of the lungs(Left side) include

Questions.question: The content of the superior mediastinum include
options: Aortic arch
Brochiocephalic artery
Right common carotid artery
Right subclavian artery
Vagus nerve
Questions.explanation:
The content of the superior mediastinum are 
 1. Organs: Thymus, Trachea and Oesophagus 
 2 Arteries: Aortic arch, Brachiocephalic artery, left subclavian artery, left common carotid artery 
 3. Veins: Left and right Brachiocephalic veins, left superior intercostal vein, upper half of superior vena cava 
 4. Muscle: Sternohyoid, sternothyroid, lower end of longus colli
 5. Nerves: vagus, phrenic, cardiac nerves on both sides and left recurrent laryngeal nerve
 6. lymphatics: Paratracheal, brachiocephalic and tracheobronchial nodes

Questions.question: The pericardium
options: The fibrous pericardium has a double layer of fibrous sac that encloses the heart and the root of great vessels
The serous pericardium fuses with the central tendon of the diaphragm
The transverse sinus is located above the heart
The oblique sinus lies between the left atrium anteriorly and the fibrous pericardium posteriorly
Pain associated with pericarditis originates in the fibrous pericardium

Questions.question: Regarding the surfaces and borders of the heart
options: The inferior border is mainly formed by the right ventricle
The left border is mainly formed by the left ventricle
The posterior surface is mainly formed by the left atrium
The anterior surface is mainly formed by the right ventricle
An average adult heart is approximately 12m from base to apex

Questions.question: The oesophagus
options: Is about 25cm long
Commences at the upper border of the cricoid cartilage at the level of C6 vertebra
Passes through the diaphragm at T10, 2.5 cm to the left of midline
Branches of the left gastric arteries supply the middle part
Recurrent laryngeal nerve supplies its middle part

options: Is posteriorly related to the oesophagus
Bifurcates at upper border of T8 into right and left main bronchi
May extend to 15cm long in full inspiration
Has the brachiocephalic vein anterolaterally related to it
Has its mucus membrane supplied by the phrenic nerve

parasternal node is a superficial node

The gridiron (McBurney's) incision is a left lower oblique muscle-splitting incision
Paramedian incision is made vertically 3cm from the midline and the rectus muscle is either retracted laterally or split before the posterior wall of the sheath can be excised

The lateral part of the ligament gives attachment to the tranversus abdominis muscle
The medial part of the ligament gives attachments to the Fascia lata of the Thigh

In obstetrics the following pelvic measurement are important
 1. size and shape of plevic inlet and outlet 2. Prominence of the ischial spine, and age of the woman

Questions.question: The following are true about the platypelloid pelvis
options: it is oval in shape
its ischial spine is prominent
It has a narrow pelvic outlet
they usually have prolong labour
The baby finds it difficult to engage
Questions.explanation: Platepelliod( flat pelvis) has its transverse diameter much greater than its anterior posterior diameter (i.e it is compressed anteriorposteriorly). It posses difficulty in delivery

Questions.question: The following are true about the urinary bladder except
options: It is lined with transitional epithelium
Its base is the posterior surface
Its neck is in the superior surface
Its trigone is at its base
Detrusor muscle is the smooth muscle
Questions.explanation:
The Urinary bladder is lined by transitonal epithelium. 
 it has  a 
 1. base(or posterior surface. It contains the trigone) 
 2 neck(lowest and most fixed part of the bladder. It is situated where the inferolateral and the posterior surfaces of the bladder meet) 
 3. Apex (situated at the anterior superior part of the bladder. It contains the medial umblical ligament) 
 4. Destrusor muscle as its smooth muscle

The fundus is the part below the entrance of the fallopian tubes

lines the lateral wall of the ischioanal fossa

it is broader in males

The urogenital triangle is anterior to the perineal body.
 The deep perineal pouch lies between the Superficial fascia of urogenital diaphram and the perineal membrane

 it consist of mainly the external genitalia
  The superifial perineal pouch lies between the Colles'(superficial perineal) fascia and perineal membrane
